Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: ラキヤ
Entry.EnglishText: Rakia

Entry.JapaneseText: マルコ
Entry.EnglishText: Marco

Entry.JapaneseText: 馬車屋
Entry.EnglishText: Carriage Coach

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋の息子
Entry.EnglishText: Innkeeper's Son

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋「こだま」
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>は今、どこにいる？
Entry.EnglishText: So, where's <Eugene>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカのはずれにある メセチナ洞窟にこもっています。 何かあった時、周りに迷惑を かけたくないからって。
Entry.EnglishText: He locked himself up inside the Mesechina Caverns on the outskirts of Balka. He said it was to avoid troubling anyone.

Entry.JapaneseText: 急ぎましょう、<Veigue>さん。 思ったより遅くなっちゃったし、 私たち二人だけでも行った ほうがいいかも……
Entry.EnglishText: Let's hurry, <Veigue>. Getting here took longer than I had anticipated, so perhaps it would be best for just the two of us to go...

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、あいつも…… <Tytree>も呼んで行こう。 呼ばないと後でうるさい。 それに……頼りになる。
Entry.EnglishText: No, we should go grab <Tytree> as well. We'll never hear the end of it if we don't. Besides... we can count on him.

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。
Entry.EnglishText: All right.

Entry.JapaneseText: 待って……
Entry.EnglishText: Just a moment?

Entry.JapaneseText: わたくしとクレアの事を、 ご両親は知っているのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Are Claire's parents aware of what happened between the two of us?

Entry.JapaneseText: 今から…… わたくしはクレアになります。
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Then I shall act as Claire for the time being.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたには酷かもしれないけれど…… あの人たちを悲しませたくは ないでしょう？
Entry.EnglishText: It may make you uncomfortable, but... I don't think you want to make them upset, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ……
Entry.EnglishText: Agarte...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今はまだ、本当の事を 伝えるべきではないと思うから……
Entry.EnglishText: I believe now would not be the best time to inform them of the truth.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたもそのように ふるまってください。 ……お願いします……
Entry.EnglishText: I ask that you treat me as though I were her... Please.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ああ。 行こう……<Red>クレア<White>。
Entry.EnglishText: Alright. Let's go, <Red>Claire<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: とてもいい顔をしてるわ、<Veigue>。 帰って来た時とは別人みたい……
Entry.EnglishText: You're looking so much better, <Veigue>. Completely different than how you were when you first got here...

Entry.JapaneseText: おばさん……
Entry.EnglishText: Aunt Rakia...

Entry.JapaneseText: 壁を…… 乗り越えたんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: You've managed to overcome your problems...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……おじさん……
Entry.EnglishText: Uncle Marco...

Entry.JapaneseText: そろそろ、 それもやめないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Isn't it about time you stopped calling us that?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh?

Entry.JapaneseText: 前にも言ったじゃないか。 おまえは私たちの息子なんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Haven't we told you this before? You are our son.

Entry.JapaneseText: 亡くなったご両親が、おまえに どれほど大きな愛を注いだかは、 私たちにはわからない。
Entry.EnglishText: We will never know the true depths of the love that your late parents felt for you...
Entry.Notes: Sounded a bit awkward to me, might still be. DRAGON: It's fine.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、私たちの気持ちは それに負けていないつもりだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...But that doesn't make our own feelings for you any less significant.

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう…… 父さん……母さん……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you, Mom... Dad...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>…… いつか……本当の事、話してね。
Entry.EnglishText: And <Veigue>? Someday... tell us the truth.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……クレアの事…… 私たちなら大丈夫だから。
Entry.EnglishText: About what happened to Claire. We'll be able to handle it.

Entry.JapaneseText: どなたか知りませんが、 我々のためにありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: Though we don't know who you are, we're thankful that you did this for our sake.

Entry.JapaneseText: いいえ、わかります。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't worry about it, we understand.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……クレアは、オレが必ず…… 無事に連れて帰ります。
Entry.EnglishText: I promise, I'll bring Claire home safe.

Entry.JapaneseText: 待ってるよ、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: We'll be waiting, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 行って来ます。 ……父さん、母さん。
Entry.EnglishText: ...So long, Mom, Dad. I'll be back.

Entry.JapaneseText: 申し訳ありません。 馬車は運休となっております。
Entry.EnglishText: We're truly sorry, but carriages are not available for use at the moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>お金が足りないようですね。 馬車のご利用料金は <nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>You seem to be short on money. The fee for using the carriage is <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>馬車をご利用になりますか？ 料金は定額で<nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>Would you like to use a carriage? The fare is a flat rate of <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車を利用しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Travel by Carriage? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナール
Entry.EnglishText: Minal

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: 馬車に乗らない
Entry.EnglishText: Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車で<unk18:48F40C28B8048880>に移動します。 料金<nmb:12C>ガルド はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>The fare to <unk18:48F40C28B8048880>is <nmb:12C> Gald. Embark Stay

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズは田舎だけど、 涼しくて、避暑には最高よ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz might be rural, but it's a great place to escape the summer heat.

Entry.JapaneseText: 田舎だから、大した事件も なくって平和だし。
Entry.EnglishText: And since it's rural, nothing happens, so it's rather peaceful.

Entry.JapaneseText: 事件って言えば…… 集会所のアレくらいかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: I think the only real incident was the one at the Meeting House?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>…… あんた大変な事しでかして……
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>...you made a huge mess of things...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアはもとに戻ったから よかったようなものの……
Entry.EnglishText: But since Claire is back to normal, I guess that's worth celebrating...

Entry.JapaneseText: マルコさんたちが かばってくれなかったら、 今頃大変だったわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If Marco and Rakia hadn't covered for you, you'd have been in big trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: 平和な村なのに、 あんな大事件……!! どうしましょ……
Entry.EnglishText: To think something like that happened in a peaceful village like this..! Oh, what to do...

Entry.JapaneseText: ホント、どうしましょ！ どうすればいいの!?
Entry.EnglishText: Really, what should I do! What would be good to do!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私が騒いでも どうしようもないんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Even though yelling about it isn't going to help...

Entry.JapaneseText: マルコさんもラキヤさんも、 口には出さないけど、 とてもつらそうなのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Marco and Rakia aren't talking about it, but they seem really upset...

Entry.JapaneseText: 早くクレアを助けて 連れ帰ってあげて……
Entry.EnglishText: Hurry and save Claire. Bring her home...
Entry.Notes: comma splice. You'd use either a semicolon here or separate into two sentences.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、クレアはどうなったの？ こんなところで油売ってる場合なの!?
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, what happened to Claire? Are you really just going to sit here and twiddle your thumbs?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマのために働くなんて、 馬鹿馬鹿しいわよね？ あなたもそう思うでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Working for the sake of Huma is such a ridiculous idea... Wouldn't you agree?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんで私がヒューマのために 草むしりなんてやらなきゃ いけないのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: Why is it that I have to do all this weeding for those Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: バカバカしい……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Ridiculous...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 空から何か降って来やしないか、 いつもビクビク…… 草むしりもしてらんないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Worrying if something's going to come falling out of the sky is keeping me on edge... I can't even bring myself to keep weeding.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今日はいい青空が広がってるねぇ…… 遠くの山までよく見えるよ……
Entry.EnglishText: There's a lovely blue sky today... You can even see the mountains in the distance...

Entry.JapaneseText: お客さん、 どこから来たの？
Entry.EnglishText: Where are you folks from?

Entry.JapaneseText: 母さんが、 「<Veigue>のそばに寄ると 凍らされるから近づくな」って……
Entry.EnglishText: My mom told me not to go near you or I'd get frozen...

Entry.JapaneseText: ごっつくてコワイ人と 青白いイジワルそうな人が クレアを連れてっちゃったよー!!
Entry.EnglishText: Some scary tough guy and a pale guy just kidnapped Claire!

Entry.JapaneseText: せっかくもとに戻ったのに…… クレア、かわいそう！
Entry.EnglishText: And right after she finally came back... Poor Claire!

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアが連れ去られたのも…… <Veigue>のせいだって……
Entry.EnglishText: Claire was kidnapped... And it's <Veigue>'s fault...

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、だって…… 母ちゃんが……
Entry.EnglishText: No, well... That's what my mom said...

Entry.JapaneseText: またなんかあったの？ <Veigue>がまた……??
Entry.EnglishText: Did something happen again? Was it <Veigue> again...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええと、おじちゃんは ガジュマだから……
Entry.EnglishText: Umm, well, since my uncle is a Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: いいのか……
Entry.EnglishText: Is it okay...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマなんかと 口利くもんじゃないって 言われたから……
Entry.EnglishText: I was told that I shouldn't be talking to Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとかヒューマとか ……どうして、みんな そんな事、言ってたのかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma this, Huma that... ...Why is everybody talking about that kind of stuff?

Entry.JapaneseText: ぼく、行きたいけど…… お母さんが、ヒューマがいる ところには行くなって……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd like to go, but... My mother told me that I can't be around Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえと仲のいい ヒューマの子がいただろう？ もう会ってないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Weren't you friends with a Huma, though? Do you no longer keep in touch with him?

Entry.JapaneseText: うん……
Entry.EnglishText: Well...

Entry.JapaneseText: 嫌いになったわけじゃ ないだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: And that's not because you don't like him, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとかガジュマとか 言う前に、トモダチだろう？
Entry.EnglishText: Aren't the two of you friends first, and Huma or Gajuma second?
Entry.Notes: Before you say Huma or Gajuma, you're Tomodachi, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズの 仲間じゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Aren't we all neighbors living in Sulz?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……うん、そうだよね…… ぼく……行くよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah... You're right! I'm... I'm gonna go!

Entry.JapaneseText: 集会所だよね。 ぼく、行くよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: The Meeting House, right? I'll be there!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか地面がゴゴゴって…… もしかして、地面から 何か出てくるの!?
Entry.EnglishText: Why is the ground rumbling like that... Is something gonna come out of it!?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの父ちゃんは 宿屋やってるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: My father is the innkeeper!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……寄ってく？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you gonna stop by?

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、<Veigue>、 遊んでよー!!
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Veigue>! Let's play!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>ちゃん、 助かってよかったわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank goodness <Claire> has been saved...

Entry.JapaneseText: うちにも顔見せなさいって 言っといてよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Tell her to stop by here too, will ya?

Entry.JapaneseText: あら、どこから いらっしゃったのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, where are you from?

Entry.JapaneseText: ゆっくりしていってね。
Entry.EnglishText: Take your time, okay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、クレアを助けに 行くんでしょ？ これを持っていってちょうだい。
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, you're going to go save Claire, aren't you? Here, take these with you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほんの気持ち程度だけど、 持ってて困るものじゃないから。
Entry.EnglishText: This is just a small token of my appreciation, so don't feel bad about taking them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 次からは買いに来てね。 <Veigue>、気をつけてね！
Entry.EnglishText: Next time you'll have to pay. Take care, <Veigue>!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか集会所の 広場の方が騒がしいけど……
Entry.EnglishText: There seems to be a lot of ruckus over by the Meeting House...

Entry.JapaneseText: また、あの連中が……??
Entry.EnglishText: Is it those soldiers again?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうねえ、 ポプラおばさんのパイでも食べたら 元気になれるかもしれないけれど……
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Maybe I would feel better if I had some of Ms. Poplar's pie...

Entry.JapaneseText: でもガジュマも来るのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: But Gajuma might be there as well...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 道具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: がんばってくるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Do your best out there.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気をつけて 行ってらっしゃい。
Entry.EnglishText: Take care and have a good day.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>!! さっき、クレアを見たけど…… 夢じゃないわよね？
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>! I saw Claire walking around earlier... This isn't a dream, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, she's back...

Entry.JapaneseText: よかった……よかったわね！ なんだかウソみたい…… 夢じゃ……ないのよね？
Entry.EnglishText: Thank goodness! It's almost too good to be true... Like a dream...but not really...?

Entry.JapaneseText: この辺りでは見ない顔ですね。 どこか遠くの方から いらしたのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: You're a face I've never seen before. What far-away place did you come from?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、 がんばってくるのよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You've got this, <Veigue>!

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅立ちの前に、色々と 準備だけはしておきなさいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Before you head out, you should get all your stuff ready.

Entry.JapaneseText: 必ずクレアを助けてくださいね！ <Veigue>をよろしくお願いします！
Entry.EnglishText: Please do whatever you can to help save Claire! For <Veigue>'s sake as well!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、旅には色々なものが 必要になる時があるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, there will be times where you'll require various items on your travels.

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々な街で、お店があった時には、 こまめに必要なものを買って、 備えておくのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: When you visit any town that has a store in it, make sure to stock up and be prepared.

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアを助けてください…… <Veigue>をよろしくお願いします！
Entry.EnglishText: Please help <Veigue> save Claire...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当はガジュマなんかに 売りたくないけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I really don't want to sell to a Gajuma, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: できれば、 もう来てほしくないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: If you can, try not to come back, will ya...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当はガジュマになんか 売りたくないのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I really don't want to sell to a Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当よ、本当だからね。
Entry.EnglishText: Since I really don't, I really won't.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか最近、あんまり商売に 身が入らないのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Lately, I haven't been giving my business my all...

Entry.JapaneseText: この村の雰囲気のせいかも しれないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: I guess it's because of everything going on in the village...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか、商売どころじゃ なさそうだけど、 そうも言ってられないわよね。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not sure why, but I don't feel like I should be open for business. ...but I can't tell people that.

Entry.JapaneseText: とても不安だわ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm all worried...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、お店での売買の コツは、「ほどほど」よ。
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, if you want to buy and sell things at the store, moderation is key.

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな田舎の店じゃ、 大したものもそろえられないわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Out here in the sticks, you can't really get much at the store.

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカ辺りにでも 買出しに行こうかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: Now if you were to go shopping in a place like Balka...

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てください。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back soon.
